example:
A: I think my dad's having a midlife crisis, he just bought a Tesla.
B: For real? That's so cliche, but honestly, let him live.
A: I guess it's better than him just being depressed and stuck in a rut.
B: Exactly, sometimes you just need to blow some cash to feel alive.
A: True, but he's also talking about quitting his job to become a DJ.
B: Okay, that definitely sounds like a midlife crisis in full swing.

meaning: 인생의 변곡점이나 성장 단계 (사춘기, 갱년기 등)
example:
A: Moving to NYC feels like such a major life transition for me.
B: It really is, you're basically hitting the reset button on everything.
A: I'm nervous, but I feel like I'm finally entering a new chapter.
B: That's the vibe! Most people just stay stuck in their comfort zone.
A: I didn't want to look back at 40 and regret not taking the leap.
B: You're evolving, and that's exactly what life's about, no cap.

primary: I've been meaning to tell you
similar: I've been wanting to bring this up
I've had this on my mind for a bit
I was gonna tell you earlier
example:
A: Hey, I’ve been meaning to tell you, your new haircut looks fire.
B: Oh, thank you! I was honestly so nervous about going this short.
A: It totally suits your vibe, I should have said something sooner.
B: No worries, I’m just glad I didn't mess up my entire look.
A: Nah, you’re killing it. I might actually steal your stylist's info.
B: Say less, I'll text you her handle right now.

meaning: 내면을 깊이 성찰하며 얻는 정신적 깨달음
example:
A: I noticed you've been way more low-key lately, what's up?
B: Honestly, I went on this meditation retreat and had a total spiritual awakening.
A: Wait, deadass? You’re like a whole different person now.
B: I just realized I was chasing the wrong things for way too long.
A: That's deep. So you're basically a monk now, just less robes?
B: Haha, pretty much. I'm just focused on my inner peace these days.

meaning: 소금이나 식초로 절여 숙성시킨 고등어 (시메사바 등)
example:
A: Have you tried the cured mackerel at that new omakase spot?
B: Not yet, I usually find mackerel a bit too fishy for me.
A: This one is different, the curing process makes it so buttery.
B: Really? If it’s vinegar-heavy, I might actually give it a shot.
A: It’s the perfect balance of salty and tangy, you'll love it.
B: Alright, you convinced me. Let's book a table for next week.

meaning: 우리 애 정밀 많이 컸다 (벌써 숙녀 다 됐네)
example:
A: I saw your daughter's prom pics, she's all grown up!
B: I know, it feels like just yesterday I was dropping her at daycare.
A: Time literally flies, she looks so sophisticated in that dress.
B: She really does. She's starting to act way more mature lately too.
A: It's a bit bittersweet though, isn't it? Her leaving for college soon.
B: Definitely. I'm proud of her, but I'm gonna miss my little girl.

meaning: 니 인생이나 똑바로 살아라 (남 참견하지 말고)
example:
A: Did you see what he posted on Twitter? He's such a hater.
B: Honestly, he just needs to get a life and stop stalking everyone.
A: Right? Like, doesn't he have anything better to do with his time?
B: Pathetic. People like that just live for the drama online.
A: I'm just gonna block him, I don't need that energy on my feed.
B: Good move. Let him yap to himself in his own little bubble.

meaning: 사람은 절대 안 변한다 (본성은 어디 안 간다)
similar: Once a liar, always a liar
A leopard doesn't change its spots
example:
A: He promised me he'd stop being late, but here we are again.
B: I told you, people never change. You gotta stop being so naive.
A: I just wanted to give him the benefit of the doubt one last time.
B: It's been three years. At this point, it's just who he is.
A: You're right. I'm just wasting my breath trying to fix him.
B: Exactly. Either accept his messiness or just move on already.

A: I need a new contractor for the kitchen, can you find me a good one?
B: Sure, I'll call around and see who can give us the best quote.
A: Make sure they're legit though, I don't want a cheap but messy job.
B: Don't worry, I'll compare the most competitive rates in town.
A: If they can do it under 20k, I'm ready to sign today.
B: Say less. I'll get those numbers to you by tomorrow afternoon.

A: Your kitchen looks like a professional studio, what's all this?
B: I went a little overboard with the new kitchenware lately.
A: That cast-iron skillet looks expensive, is it worth the hype?
B: Deadass, it turns everything into a five-star meal.
A: I definitely need to upgrade my basic pots and pans then.
B: Start with a good knife and a solid pan, that's all you really need.

A: How long have you and Sarah been best friends?
B: Oh, she's my day-one. We've been tight since preschool.
A: That's crazy, I can't even remember who I knew back then.
B: She’s literally like my sister. I trust her with my life.
A: Everyone needs a ride-or-die like that in this city.
B: For real, NYC is too intense to navigate without a real squad.

A: Omg bestie, your outfit is literally everything today.
B: Stop, you're making me blush! I got it on sale too.
A: That's even better, we love a good bargain queen energy.
B: Exactly! I'm trying to look expensive on a budget tonight.
A: We are definitely gonna be the main characters at this party.
B: Say less, let's go grab some drinks and start the night.

A: Why is your sister giving you the side-eye all morning?
B: I might have frustrated her by taking her charger without asking.
A: You know how she is about her tech, why would you do that?
B: I was in a rush and my phone was dead, I didn't think it through.
A: Well, you definitely got under her skin. You better apologize.
B: I tried, but she told me to 'stop yapping' and locked her door.

A: Did you see the new tuition rates for next semester?
B: Yeah, they're insane. It's like they want us to go broke.
A: I'm already stressed about my student loans as it is.
B: Tell me about it. We’re basically paying for the brand name now.
A: I might have to get a second job just to cover the books.
B: Same. This education system is truly wild, no cap.

A: How's the freelance life treating you financially?
B: I'm just getting by, honestly. It's not as lucrative as I hoped.
A: NYC is so expensive, 'just getting by' here is a struggle.
B: For real, I'm basically making ends meet and that's about it.
A: Hopefully that big contract you mentioned comes through soon.
B: I'm praying for it. Otherwise, I might have to move back home.

A: This Chardonnay is so buttery and smooth, I love the finish.
B: It goes perfectly with this pasta, right? The sauce is amazing too.
A: Everything is just so rich. My taste buds are literally heaven.
B: I knew you'd like this place. Their steak is also peak buttery.
A: Stop, I’m already getting full just thinking about it.
B: Trust me, you gotta try at least one bite. It’s a total game changer.

A: I heard about your grandmother, I am so sorry for your loss.
B: Thank you. She passed away peacefully in her sleep last week.
A: Were you guys able to have a service for her yet?
B: Yeah, she was cremated and we placed her in a niche yesterday.
A: That must have been a tough day for your whole family.
B: It was, but we’re glad she’s finally at peace now.

meaning: 말 꺼내서 부정 타게 하지 마 (설레발 치지 마)
similar: Let's not get ahead of ourselves
example:
A: We're totally gonna get the job, the interview was perfect.
B: Shhh, don't jinx it! We haven't gotten the offer yet.
A: I'm just feeling confident, the manager really liked us.
B: I know, but let's just knock on wood for good luck.
A: Okay, okay. I'll stop talking about it until the email lands.
B: Thank you. I don't want any bad energy ruining this for us.

A: And then she said that I was the one who started the whole...
B: Oh my god, can you please stop yapping about her for five minutes?
A: I'm just trying to tell you what happened at the party!
B: I've heard this story three times today, I'm literally exhausted.
A: Finely, I'll shut up. You're so moody lately.
B: I'm not moody, I just need some peace and quiet, no cap.

meaning: 모든 조건이나 요구 사항을 완벽히 충족하다
example:
A: So, how was the second date with that guy from Hinge?
B: Actually, he checks all the boxes. He's funny, smart, and tall.
A: No way! Is there a catch? There's always a catch.
B: Honestly, I haven't found one yet. He's just a solid guy.
A: Well, if he's the full package, don't let him go too easy.
B: I'm trying to play it cool, but I'm definitely into him.

primary: put it down before I forget
example:
A: We need to buy more batteries and some light bulbs.
B: Hang on, let me put that down before I forget.
A: While you're at it, add some almond milk to the list too.
B: Got it. My memory has been total trash lately.
A: Same, if I don't write it down immediately, it's gone forever.
B: For real. Okay, the list is updated. What's next?

A: Did you see his reaction when he got fired? He was so nonchalant.
B: Right? I would have been literally sobbing on the floor.
A: He just packed his bag and walked out like nothing happened.
B: He’s always been unfazed by drama, but that was next level.
A: I wish I had that much emotional control in stressful situations.
B: Same, but sometimes I think he just doesn't care at all.

meaning: 정말 비현실적일 정도로 좋았다 (말도 안 되게 대단했다)
example:
A: How was your trip to Tokyo? I saw the photos online.
B: Honestly, it's been unreal. I'm still processing everything.
A: The food looked like it was from another planet.
B: It was! The whole vibe of the city is just totally surreal.
A: I'm so jealous, I need to book a flight there ASAP.
B: Deadass, it’s a life-changing place. You have to go.

A: You look like a zombie, did you even sleep last night?
B: Barely. I've been pulling a lot of all-nighters for this final project.
A: That's rough. You need to take a break before you crash.
B: I know, but if I don't finish this today, I'm gonna fail.
A: Drink some coffee and just power through one last time.
B: I'm on my fourth cup already. My heart is literally racing.

similar: Make my heart skip a beat
Make me weak in the knees
example:
A: Whenever he looks at me and smiles, it makes my heart flutter.
B: Ooh, someone's got a major crush! That's so cute.
A: I'm trying to act normal, but I'm literally dying inside.
B: Girl, those butterflies are the best part of a new thing.
A: Except for the part where I can't even speak properly around him.
B: Just be yourself, he clearly likes the vibe you're giving off.

meaning: 내가 지금 착각하고 있는 건가? (김칫국 마시는 거야?)
similar: Is this all in my head?
example:
A: He liked my old photo from three years ago. Am I delusional for thinking he's interested?
B: Honestly? Yeah, a little bit. That's a classic accidental deep-stalk swipe.
A: But why would he even be on my profile that late at night?
B: People get bored on Instagram, don't read too much into it.
A: You're right. I'm totally trippin' over nothing.
B: Exactly. Let's focus on someone who actually texts you back.

A: Can you help me move my piano this Saturday morning?
B: I can't possibly do that, I'm working a double shift both days.
A: Are you sure? I really need someone strong like you.
B: Deadass, I’m gonna be exhausted. It’s just not happening.
A: Fine, I'll see if Greg can help instead.
B: Good luck with that, Greg’s back is even worse than mine.

primary: Are you investing in shares market?
example:
A: Hey, are you investing in the shares market lately? Everything is so volatile.
B: I'm mostly into ETFs. I don't have the stomach for individual stocks.
A: Smart move. I got burned pretty bad on some tech stocks last month.
B: That's why I just 'buy the dip' and hold for the long term.
A: I should have listened to you. I’m down like 20% right now.
B: Don't panic sell. Just wait it out and it'll probably recover.

meaning: 주식 시장 (기관/개인 투자자, 변동성 등 전문 용어)
example:
A: The stock market took a massive hit today due to the inflation data.
B: Yeah, high volatility is scaring off a lot of retail investors.
A: Institutional investors are probably just waiting for a better entry point.
B: Exactly. Everyone is keeping a close eye on the Fed's next move.
A: If rates go up again, we might see a more prolonged bear market.
B: It's a stressful time to be managing a portfolio, for sure.

A: I didn't think we'd finish the presentation in time, but we pulled it off.
B: Honestly, it was a close call. That last-minute edit saved us.
A: The client loved it though, so all that stress was worth it.
B: We really nailed the final pitch. Great teamwork, everyone.
A: Let's celebrate tonight, we definitely earned some drinks.
B: Say less. I know a great rooftop bar nearby.

A: This burger is literally the best thing I've ever eaten, no cap.
B: You say that about every burger place we go to, though.
A: No, for real this time. The sauce is actually insane.
B: Okay, let me try a bite... Wow, you weren't lying. That's fire.
A: See? I told you. Best in the city, deadass.
B: Alright, I'll give it to you. This is top-tier.

A: My feed is still showing posts from yesterday, what's wrong?
B: Just pull down to refresh, it probably just needs a quick sync.
A: I already tried that, but it's still stuck on the same photo.
B: Maybe your wifi is trippin'. Try switching to data.
A: Oh, that worked. Now I see all the new drama.
B: Perfect. Now you can get back to being a hater, haha.

A: I'm quitting my job on Friday, but not a word to anyone yet.
B: Wait, what? Are you serious? Where are you going?
A: I got an offer from that startup in Brooklyn, but it's not official.
B: That's huge! I promise, my lips are sealed. Not a word.
A: Thank you. I don't want any corporate drama before I leave.
B: I got you. Your secret is totally safe with me.

meaning: 알았어, 더 말 안 해도 이해했어 (바로 할게)
example:
A: Can you grab some ice on your way to the party tonight?
B: Say less, I'll pick up two bags and some extra cups too.
A: You're a lifesaver, everyone always forgets the ice.
B: I've been to enough NYC house parties to know the drill.
A: True. See you around 9 then?
B: I'll be there. I'll text you when I'm pulling up.
